ip: is ‘source’ or ‘beginning’. This document, here it's written the making of sky/heaven and of land, the source of person, and the beginning of sin and suffering here of world. Written again here the account concerning the people chosen by God and the carrying din them there to place he promised them.

meta.ip: Divided of two this the document:

1.) The making of world and the account concerning the people. Here can be read the account concerning Adam and ki Eve, the concerning Kain and ki Abil, and the concerning Noah and the pegsipuk of water, and the concerning the tall house there to Babil.

2.) The account concerning the first elders of Israilita. Abraham the first elder of Israilita became famous due to faith and trusting din and of obedience din of suhu of God. Egpakasinundul also the account concerning his child Isaac, and the apu din Yacob (named ded also ki Israel), and the ten and two (12) child of Yacob iyan source of ten and two (12) descendants of Israel. Told also here the concerning the child of Yacob Yosef and the what happened kandin iyan reason of went to of Egypt Yacob other of his children.

Egkabasa ta again here the account concerning the various people proliferated here of ampew of land and migmannenasud e. Labew of all, told here the large work of God making of sky/heaven and land and of all nakatahu here.

There in final of account, is told the without ending promise of God of his people. Not forgotten of God his promise and not din indeed ignore the his people because taught and helping din them. And/Now he the judging and punishing of all doing of bad.

contents.s1: The six days of creation

contents.rem: /s1 Six Days of Creation and the Sabbath; The Account of Creation; The Beginning; The Story of Creation; The creation of the universe

contents: In the beginning, God

f.ft: As per common practice, we use ‘God’ through the Hebrew scriptures for the word ‘elohim’. Note that ‘elohim’ is a Hebrew language plural, and is translated more literally as ‘gods’ in a few places. However the connected Hebrew verb translated ‘created’ here is clearly a singular form, so the singular noun ‘God’ fits better here and everywhere where ‘elohim’ is used with other verbs marked as being singular. The mysterious plurality of God is confirmed in v26 where ‘our’ is used to refer to him/them.

contents: created the heavens and the earth.
contents.verseText: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.

contents: The earth was formless and empty and darkness covered the surface of the depth
and God's spirit was hovering over the surface of the waters.
contents.verseText: The earth was formless and empty and darkness covered the surface of the depth waters and God's spirit was hovering over the surface of the waters.

contents: Then God said, “Let there be light,” and light came into existence,
contents.verseText: Then God said, “Let there be light,” and light came into existence,

contents: and God observed that the light was good. Then he separated the light from the darkness.
contents.verseText: and God observed that the light was good. Then he separated the light from the darkness.

contents: God named the light
, and the darkness he named
. Then evening came, and
morning came,

contents.add: and that was the end of the

contents: first day.
contents.verseText: God named the light daytime, and the darkness he named nighttime. Then evening came, and later morning came, and that was the end of the first day.

contents: Then God said, “Let there be a large space in the middle of the waters, and let it separate the two lots of waters.”
contents.verseText: Then God said, “Let there be a large space in the middle of the waters, and let it separate the two lots of waters.”

contents: So God made the large space and separated between the waters that were underneath from the waters that were above it. Everything happened
as he commanded,
contents.verseText: So God made the large space and separated between the waters that were underneath from the waters that were above it. Everything happened exactly as he commanded,

contents: and he named the space
. Then evening came, and
morning came,

contents.add: and that was the end of

contents: the second day.
contents.verseText: and he named the space sky. Then evening came, and later morning came, and that was the end of the second day.

contents: Then God said, “Let the waters under the sky be gathered to one place, and let the dry ground appear.” Everything happened
as he commanded,
contents.verseText: Then God said, “Let the waters under the sky be gathered to one place, and let the dry ground appear.” Everything happened exactly as he commanded,

contents: and he named the ground that appeared
, and he named the gathered waters
, and he saw that
was good.
contents.verseText: and he named the ground that appeared land, and he named the gathered waters seas, and he saw that what he had done was good.

contents: Then God said, “Let the land sprout vegetation: every plant yielding seed, every fruit tree bearing its own fruit that has its seed inside it, on the earth.” Everything happened
as he commanded,
contents.verseText: Then God said, “Let the land sprout vegetation: every plant yielding seed, every fruit tree bearing its own fruit that has its seed inside it, on the earth.” Everything happened exactly as he commanded,

contents: so the land started producing vegetation, every plant producing its own seed, and every tree bearing fruit that has its seed inside it. And God saw that
was good.
contents.verseText: so the land started producing vegetation, every plant producing its own seed, and every tree bearing fruit that has its seed inside it. And God saw that what he had done was good.

contents: Then evening came, and
morning came,

contents.add: and that was the end of

contents: the third day.
contents.verseText: Then evening came, and later morning came, and that was the end of the third day.

contents: Then God said, “Let there be lights in the sky to separate daytime from nighttime, so they'll be signs, and for
seasons, and for
days and years.
contents.verseText: Then God said, “Let there be lights in the sky to separate daytime from nighttime, so they'll be signs, and for indicating seasons, and for tracking days and years.

contents: They must function as lights in the sky that shine
on the earth.” Everything happened
as he commanded,
contents.verseText: They must function as lights in the sky that shine light on the earth.” Everything happened exactly as he commanded,

contents: so God made the two large lights, the larger, brighter light to rule the day, and the smaller light to rule the night, and he
made the stars.
contents.verseText: so God made the two large lights, the larger, brighter light to rule the day, and the smaller light to rule the night, and he also made the stars.

contents: He put those lights in the sky to shine
on the earth,
contents.verseText: He put those lights in the sky to shine light on the earth,

contents: and to oversee the daytime and the nighttime, and to distinguish between the light and the darkness. And God saw that
was good.
contents.verseText: and to oversee the daytime and the nighttime, and to distinguish between the light and the darkness. And God saw that what he had done was good.

contents: Then evening came, and
morning came,

contents.add: and that was the end of

contents: the fourth day.
contents.verseText: Then evening came, and later morning came, and that was the end of the fourth day.

contents: Then God said, “Let the waters be full of with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly in the sky above the earth.”
contents.verseText: Then God said, “Let the waters be full of with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly in the sky above the earth.”

contents: So God created the great sea creatures and every kind of living creature that moves which the waters swarm with, and every kind of winged bird. And God saw that
was good,
contents.verseText: So God created the great sea creatures and every kind of living creature that moves which the waters swarm with, and every kind of winged bird. And God saw that what he had done was good,

contents: and he blessed them, saying, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the waters in the seas, and let the birds multiply on the earth.”
contents.verseText: and he blessed them, saying, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the waters in the seas, and let the birds multiply on the earth.”

contents: Then evening came, and
morning came,

contents.add: and that was the end of

contents: the fifth day.

contents: Then God said, “Let the land bring forth every kind of living creature: livestock and every crawling creature and every kind of living thing on the earth.” Everything happened
as he commanded,
contents.verseText: Then God said, “Let the land bring forth every kind of living creature: livestock and every crawling creature and every kind of living thing on the earth.” Everything happened exactly as he commanded,

contents: so he made every kind of creature of the earth, and every kind of livestock, and every kind of crawling creature on the ground. And God saw that
was good.
contents.verseText: so he made every kind of creature of the earth, and every kind of livestock, and every kind of crawling creature on the ground. And God saw that what he had done was good.

contents: Then God said, “Let us make man in our image, according to our likeness, and let them rule over the fish in the sea and over the birds in the sky and over the livestock and over all the earth, and over every creature moving on the earth.”
contents.verseText: Then God said, “Let us make man in our image, according to our likeness, and let them rule over the fish in the sea and over the birds in the sky and over the livestock and over all the earth, and over every creature moving on the earth.”

contents: Then God created humankind in his image,
created in the image of God—male and female he created them.
contents.verseText: Then God created humankind in his image, yes, created in the image of God—male and female he created them.

contents: Then God blessed them and told them, “Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the earth and take control of it. You're in charge of the fish in the sea and the birds in the sky and over every living thing that moves on the earth.”
contents.verseText: Then God blessed them and told them, “Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the earth and take control of it. You're in charge of the fish in the sea and the birds in the sky and over every living thing that moves on the earth.”

contents: Then God said, “Look, I've given you every plant throughout the whole earth that yields seed, and every tree that has fruit with a seed or seeds inside it. They will be yours for food,
contents.verseText: Then God said, “Look, I've given you every plant throughout the whole earth that yields seed, and every tree that has fruit with a seed or seeds inside it. They will be yours for food,

as he commanded,

contents: What follows tells

f.ft: This little formula is sometimes known as a ‘toledoth’ (or ‘tōlədōt’, from the Hebrew word) and seems to mark a new section, but it's debated whether this part belongs at the bottom of the previous section, or at the top of the following section. We're assuming the later here.

contents: the history of what God did when he created the heavens and the earth:

contents.rem: /s1 The Garden of Eden; The Man and Woman in Eden; Another Account of the Creation

contents.p: During the time when Yahweh God made the earth and the heavens,

contents.verseText: What follows tells more details about the history of what God did when he created the heavens and the earth: During the time when Yahweh God made the earth and the heavens,

contents: there weren't yet any bushes growing on the earth, and no plants had yet sprung up in the fields, because Yahweh God had not yet made it rain, and nor were there any people yet to till the ground.
contents.verseText: there weren't yet any bushes growing on the earth, and no plants had yet sprung up in the fields, because Yahweh God had not yet made it rain, and nor were there any people yet to till the ground.

contents: However, a mist came up from the ground and watered the entire surface of the land.
contents.verseText: However, a mist came up from the ground and watered the entire surface of the land.

contents: Then Yahweh God formed the
man out of the dust on the ground and he breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living person.
contents.verseText: Then Yahweh God formed the first man out of the dust on the ground and he breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living person.

contents: Now in the east, Yahweh God had planted a garden in Eden, and he put the man there that he had formed.
contents.verseText: Now in the east, Yahweh God had planted a garden in Eden, and he put the man there that he had formed.

contents: He
caused all kinds of trees to grow there—
that are pleasant to look at and good for food. In the middle of the garden was the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil
contents.verseText: He also caused all kinds of trees to grow there—some that are pleasant to look at and good for food. In the middle of the garden was the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil

contents: A river flowed out of Eden to water the garden, and then from there it split into four rivers.
contents.verseText: A river flowed out of Eden to water the garden, and then from there it split into four rivers.

contents: The first river was named Pishon, and it winds around through the entire region of Havilah, where there's gold.
contents.verseText: The first river was named Pishon, and it winds around through the entire region of Havilah, where there's gold.

contents: The gold from there is
, and there's also
and onyx
there.
contents.verseText: The gold from there is very pure, and there's also a type of fragrant resin and onyx gemstones there.

contents: The second river was named Gihon, and it winds through the entire region of Cush.
contents.verseText: The second river was named Gihon, and it winds through the entire region of Cush.

contents: The third river was named Tigris, and it flowed east of the Asshur
, and then the fourth river was
Frat.
contents.verseText: The third river was named Tigris, and it flowed east of the Asshur region, and then the fourth river was named Frat.

contents: Yahweh God took the man and put him in the garden at Eden to cultivate and maintain it
contents.verseText: Yahweh God took the man and put him in the garden at Eden to cultivate and maintain it

contents: and instructed him, “You can eat as much
as you want from any tree in the garden,
contents.verseText: and instructed him, “You can eat as much fruit as you want from any tree in the garden,

contents: but you mustn't eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, because the day you eat its
you'll certainly die.”
contents.verseText: but you mustn't eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, because the day you eat its fruit you'll certainly die.”

contents: Then Yahweh God said, “It's not good for the man to be alone, so I'll make a suitable helper for him.”
contents.verseText: Then Yahweh God said, “It's not good for the man to be alone, so I'll make a suitable helper for him.”

contents: Now Yahweh God had formed every living thing of the field and every bird of the sky from the ground, so he brought them to the man to see what he would call them, and whatever the man called each living creature, that would become its name.
contents.verseText: Now Yahweh God had formed every living thing of the field and every bird of the sky from the ground, so he brought them to the man to see what he would call them, and whatever the man called each living creature, that would become its name.

contents: The man gave names to all the
livestock and to the birds of the sky and to every living creature in the fields, but none of them was a suitable
to help him.
contents.verseText: The man gave names to all the various livestock and to the birds of the sky and to every living creature in the fields, but none of them was a suitable companion to help him.

contents: So Yahweh God caused the man to go into a deep sleep, and then while he was sleeping, he removed one of his ribs and closed up
its place with flesh.
contents.verseText: So Yahweh God caused the man to go into a deep sleep, and then while he was sleeping, he removed one of his ribs and closed up over its place with flesh.

contents: Then Yahweh God used the rib which he had taken from the man to form into a woman, and he brought her to the man,
contents.verseText: Then Yahweh God used the rib which he had taken from the man to form into a woman, and he brought her to the man,

contents: and the man said:

contents.q1: “Now this is bone from my bones

contents.q2: because she came from a man.”

contents.verseText: and the man said: “Now this is bone from my bones and flesh from my flesh. She'll be named ‘woman’ because she came from a man.”

contents: So that's why a man leaves his father and mother, and becomes united to his wife, and the two of them become one being.
contents.verseText: So that's why a man leaves his father and mother, and becomes united to his wife, and the two of them become one being.

contents: At that time, both the man and his wife were naked, but they had no sense of shame.
contents.verseText: At that time, both the man and his wife were naked, but they had no sense of shame.

contents.s1: The couple disobey God

contents: Now the snake was the craftiest of all the animals that Yahweh God had created, and
he asked the woman, “Did God really command you to not eat
from any of the trees in the garden?”
contents.verseText: Now the snake was the craftiest of all the animals that Yahweh God had created, and one day he asked the woman, “Did God really command you to not eat fruit from any of the trees in the garden?”

contents: “No,” answered the woman, “we can eat the fruit from
of the trees in the garden,
contents.verseText: “No,” answered the woman, “we can eat the fruit from any of the trees in the garden,

contents: except from the tree that is in the centre. He commanded
to not eat that fruit or even touch it, because if we do, we will die!”
contents.verseText: except from the tree that is in the centre. He commanded us to not eat that fruit or even touch it, because if we do, we will die!”

contents: But the serpent said to the woman, “It's not definite that you'll die.
contents.verseText: But the serpent said to the woman, “It's not definite that you'll die.

contents: Actually, God knows that as soon as you eat fruit from that tree, you'll understand new things, so that you will know
right and
wrong just like God does.”
contents.verseText: Actually, God knows that as soon as you eat fruit from that tree, you'll understand new things, so that you will know what's right and what's wrong just like God does.”

contents: The woman saw that the tree's
good to eat and that the tree itself was very atractive, plus she wanted
the fruit so that it would make her wise. So she picked some of the fruit and ate it and she also gave
to her husband
with her, and he ate it
contents.verseText: The woman saw that the tree's fruit looked good to eat and that the tree itself was very atractive, plus she wanted to eat the fruit so that it would make her wise. So she picked some of the fruit and ate it and she also gave some of it to her husband who was there with her, and he ate it too.

contents: they both had new understanding and they felt their nakedness. So they sewed
fig leaves together and made skirts for themselves.
contents.verseText: Immediately they both had new understanding and they felt their nakedness. So they sewed some fig leaves together and made skirts for themselves.

contents: during the cool time of the day, the man and his wife heard Yahweh God's voice as he walked in the garden, but they hid from him behind some trees in the garden,
contents.verseText: Late that afternoon, during the cool time of the day, the man and his wife heard Yahweh God's voice as he walked in the garden, but they hid from him behind some trees in the garden,

contents: so Yahweh God called out to the man, “
where are you?”
contents.verseText: so Yahweh God called out to the man, “Adam, where are you?”

contents: “I heard you
in the garden,” he replied, “but I was scared because I was naked, so I hid
contents.verseText: “I heard you walking in the garden,” he replied, “but I was scared because I was naked, so I hid myself.”

contents: “Who told you that you're naked?” Yahweh God asked. “Have you eaten
that I told you not to eat?”
contents.verseText: “Who told you that you're naked?” Yahweh God asked. “Have you eaten the fruit that I told you not to eat?”

contents: “The woman that you put here beside me,” answered the man, “she gave me
fruit from the tree and I ate it.”
contents.verseText: “The woman that you put here beside me,” answered the man, “she gave me some fruit from the tree and I ate it.”

contents: Then Yahweh God asked the woman, “What did you do?”

contents: Yosef continued to live in Egypt, along with
his father Yacob's family, until he was 110 years old.
contents.verseText: Yosef continued to live in Egypt, along with the rest of his father Yacob's family, until he was 110 years old.

contents: He lived long enough to see his son Ephraim's children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren. The children of his grandson Machir, who was Manasseh's son, also grew up around him.
contents.verseText: He lived long enough to see his son Ephraim's children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren. The children of his grandson Machir, who was Manasseh's son, also grew up around him.

contents: Then
Yosef said to his brothers, “I'm about to die, but God will definitely help you all and take you
from this country to the land that he vowed to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Yacob.
contents.verseText: Then one day Yosef said to his brothers, “I'm about to die, but God will definitely help you all and take you and your descendants from this country to the land that he vowed to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Yacob.

contents: When God does that, you must take my body

contents.add: back to Canaan with you and bury it there

contents: .” Then Yosef had

contents.add: his brothers and the rest of the descendants of Israel

contents: vow
contents.verseText: When God does that, you must take my body back to Canaan with you and bury it there.” Then Yosef had his brothers and the rest of the descendants of Israel vow that they would do that.

contents: Then Yosef died at the age of 110, and
embalmed
and it was put in a coffin in
Egypt.
contents.verseText: Then Yosef died at the age of 110, and the specialists embalmed his body and it was put in a coffin in a tomb in Egypt.

_warnings: Trailing spaces present at line end.
